title: Operations Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Art Center College
Interview Descriptions: Met with various department representatives. Very relaxed environment and pleasant conversation. Walked around the campus and got a sense of the environment. Questions asked were related to the work I have done and how it can relate with the job offering.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience in managing projects?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: I needed to reach out to teachers for possible position and after finding a potential teacher, I gave them my resume for them to view. After viewing, I was contacted that I was accepted.
Interview Questions: Did I have an previous experience of being a teacher assistant.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Two HR personnel present at the interview. They questioned me from a list of premade interview questions and had copies of my application. 

The questions were very general, however, the interviewers did not seem to be interested in my answers and rushed onto the next question repeatedly. I was also grilled about a gap in employment in which I provided reasonable answers, but the interviewers did not seem to believe me. It seemed that the interviewers were done with the interview before it started. 

Overall, a very neutral to negative interview experience.
Interview Questions: What do you think is the most important quality to have in customer service?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview was brief and very easy. The hiring manager was not prepared and did not look over my resume to prepare for the interview let alone print one out before hand.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave your last job?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: One interview with HR, one interview with hiring manager. I applied online and heard back within two weeks. My interview with HR was brief and my interview with my supervisor was much longer, about 2 hours.
Interview Questions: Basic questions, nothing difficult.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I assisted a former instructor who was looking for a TA. The process was rather simple,  just go to your consumer to fill out any paperwork needed and than I was interviewed properly by him.  Lasted about 15 minutes, generic questions.
Interview Questions: Are you the type of assistant who stays at their desk or actively helps students and converse with them?

title: Assistant Director of Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Art Center College (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied. One month later - phone interview. A few weeks later- in person interview. A few weeks later -group interview. A few weeks later - another in person interview. A month later was offered a position. Very long process for an entry level job.
Interview Questions: How does this job fit in to your long term professional goals?

title: Administrative Offices Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College
Interview Descriptions: I waited in the lobby for several minutes past my appointment time, and then one of the interviewers came out to greet me personally. I met with the hiring manager and the second-in-command for that department for about 30 minutes, followed by a tour of the place while wrapping up the interview, which ended with one final question at the exit door. That final question had come up more than once, so the next day I addressed it in an email together with a word of thanks for the meeting. During the interview they had described the job, and the general work cycle. They did tell me quite truthfully that it was a very busy place with constant interruptions. That was an understatement.
Interview Questions: Why I was leaving my current job, for potentially less pay. What's challenging about current job.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: greeting by an admin.  Went into the office to meet the hiring manager.  Interview was more like a discussion.  This was a one to one interview.  The hiring manger was nice.  A lot of open bench office which I do not like.
Interview Questions: What is your salary expectation?  Why do you want to work here?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College
Interview Descriptions: Three interviews were conducted over a period of approximately one month. The first was a phone interview with a staff person from Human Resources. The second was a Skype interview with key members of the department. The third was an in-person interview with the director of office. Interview difficulty level was average.
Interview Questions: Questions were specific to the needs of the position.

title: Student Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
You are interviewed by a panel of the crew and manager about your past experience/skills. They also ask you about what gear you may have or know about. In effect, they are also fielding your personality (obviously). 
Takes about fifteen to twenty minutes, max.
Interview Questions: What was one time you faced a difficult situation at work, and how did you deal with it? (paraphrasing)

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Art Center College (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy-going. If you're passionate about your craft, things naturally fall in place. Speak to your professor and show love. Writing 30 words minimum is unnecessary to describe this interview process. Just ask your professor now.
Interview Questions: Who inspires you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I am a student in a graduate program at Art Center College of Design.  The interview process was largely covered by their review of my ability to be a student at the school.  When I was hired in my student worker capacity, I was asked about my interest in technology and then asked to go through a workshop on how to use the specific machines I was to be in charge of.  When I went through the workshop and then passed a proficiency test, they allowed me to become a worker.
Interview Questions: Q.  Have you ever used one of these machine?

title: Teacher Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: you personally contact your teacher of choice and talk with them about the available position. Usually it's based off professors you connect well with. After this you simply contact your current counselor and set up the availability. Just be aware that you may have to get the reservation asap. some teacher's are booked in with 3 terms worth of students lined up.
Interview Questions: when are you available ?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Art Center College (Pasadena, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Met in a non-traditional way after visiting other instructors classes.  Then was invited to join faculty.  So there was no real interview process. In fact, I never met my Dept. Chair until I was already offered the job.
Interview Questions: I actually had to request a meeting.
